intro: Brachyrhynchos trachycarpus, commonly known as the rough-seeded brachyrhynchos, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its robust, hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and horticultural interest.
